1080561927049408512.text:
In principle there are benefits in using off-the-shelf technology, but there will always be things you want different.  That's why @rv_inc chose to NOT blindly use LLVM as a VM, but instead use it as a basis for a custom VM that fits the needs (IELE):
https://runtimeverification.com/the-iele-virtual-machine/ …

1072597424806486018.text:
The pretty pictures at the end and accompanying text should explain it all!

Basically this quantifies statistically manipulation an attacker could perform on the output of the RanDAO protocol.  Alpha is the attacker's voting share (stake), y-axis shows effect of bias.pic.twitter.com/lxc9FWAuHL

1072595028961320960.text: This report on @rv_inc's verification of RANDAO's possible randomness bias under worst-case adversarial conditions using statistical model checking is one of the most underrated new papers in cryptocurrency security/modeling, IMO.https://github.com/runtimeverification/rdao-smc/blob/master/report/rdao-analysis.pdf …

1058686686236946432.text: Just arrived home from @EFDevcon. I was flooded by multiple fire hoses all week, and that’s a good thing. I’m now sitting with my AM coffee trying to flush out “lessons learned” or “takeaways”.

1054814319060402177.text:
Devcon talk teaser! I'll cover:
- What (smart contract) audits are missing
- Why all dexs are broken
- Why all blockchain voting is broken
- Why this could threaten Ethereum as a whole
- How to fix it

... it'll be fun, I promise!

1053273942851502080.text: Anything is possible, just a question of priorities & funding.  I think SC verification is a lower hanging fruit, but @rv_inc also working on models of consensus protocols [FFG,Shasper,Ourboros,etc] (and the dream is of course to eventually have a 100% formal blockchain client).

1053129486110281729.text:
Cannot agree more.  Here are some first steps in that direction of rigorously formalizing the EIPs:
- ERC20: https://runtimeverification.com/blog/erc20-k-formal-executable-specification-of-erc20/ …
- ERC777: https://runtimeverification.com/blog/erc777-k-formal-executable-specification-of-erc777/ …
Would be nice to formalize more of them, but they take a lot of expert time
@rv_inc @feindura @VitalikButerin

1044286040624844800.text:
The first ever ERC20 formal verification spec was done by @rv_inc they now made one for ERC777 as well! The next token standard. 
Now we need automated gen. proofs and checkers to run those!https://twitter.com/rv_inc/status/1044277941998407680 …

1044236684731314176.text:
And multiple types!
-SMT model checking
-Property-based checks
-Semantic equivalency
-and more...

Don't forget good, ole-fashioned functional testing!

Rule of thumb: spend 10x more effort verifying your design and validating against your models than you do writing the code.

1044221905836929025.text: Hopefully it is becoming increasingly clear that, at more than $1M value per line of code, only the irresponsible players forego formal verification.

My startup company @rv_inc won the first Ethereum Foundation Security Grant: https://blog.ethereum.org/2018/03/07/announcing-beneficiaries-ethereum-foundation-grants/ ….

The grant is to formally verify Casper, written in Vyper, all the way down to the EVM binary.  We are going to use this approach:https://github.com/runtimeverification/verified-smart-contracts …

1044983326686175232.text: ERC777-K is parametric in the execution environment. https://goo.gl/z6cSLx  It can be plugged-and-played within any execution environment which has a formal semantics, such as a virtual machine or a programming language. #ERC777 #ethereum Demohttps://youtu.be/2JWxt0N721Y

1044633880874143746.text: ERC777-K is parametric in the implementation-dependent behaviors https://goo.gl/z6cSLx  It can be easily instantiated to admit any standard-conforming implementation besides the reference implementation. ERC777-K can be quickly used to verify any potential #ERC777 implementation

1044277941998407680.text: Being executable, ERC777-K has been thoroughly tested: https://goo.gl/z6cSLx  We provide more than 200 unit tests for ERC777-K, which can be also used for potential ERC777 implementations to check if they conform to the standard. #ERC777 #ethereum Videohttps://youtu.be/2JWxt0N721Y

1043272858212941825.text: Introducing ERC777-K: Executable, testable, rigorous, comprehensive, EVM-independent formal specification for ERC777 tokens! More details: https://runtimeverification.com/blog/erc777-k-formal-executable-specification-of-erc777/ … Video:https://youtu.be/Ty2zuE0R6B4

977559620637126656.text:
Why does C11 program below segfaults when compiled with gcc -O3? It runs normally when you drop -O3.

Program has undefined behavior, caught by kcc (part of RV-Match tool https://runtimeverification.com/match/ ) as seen in picture, but what does gcc do? #undefinedbehavior #CProgrammingLanguagepic.twitter.com/Ox21noNvbR

952925521637183488.text:
IELE: a new VM for the blockchain, developed by @rv_inc in collaboration with @InputOutputHK.  One of IELE's major design forces was its programs be human-readable and machanically verifiable.  An ERC20 token in IELE: https://github.com/runtimeverification/iele-semantics/blob/master/iele-examples/erc20.iele …

Read more at https://runtimeverification.com/blog/?p=498 .

943231896074547200.text:

943226763211083777.text: @rv_inc and @InputOutputHK teamed up to design, develop and deploy IELE, a new virtual machine for the blockchain.  IELE is an LLVM-style VM designed as a formal specification in K. whose implementation is generated automatically, correct by construction.https://paymentweek.com/2017-12-18-runtime-verification-iohk-launch-virtual-machine-blockchains/ …
